verses.roman:
ambaṣṭhāmbaṣṭha mārgaṁ nau
dehy apakrama mā ciram
no cet sa-kuñjaraṁ tvādya
nayāmi yama-sādanam

synonyms: ambaṣṭha ambaṣṭha—O elephant-keeper, elephant-keeper; mārgam—way; nau—to Us; dehi—give; apakrama—move aside; ma ciram—without delay; na u cet—if not; sa-kuñjaram—together with your elephant; tvā—you; adya—today; nayāmi—I will send; yama—of the lord of death; sādanam—to the abode.
translation: [Lord Kṛṣṇa said:] O driver, driver, move aside at once and let Us pass! If you don't, this very day I will send both you and your elephant to the abode of Yamarāja!
